results.title: The Task before the building industry
results.brief_description: A survey of the task of building still facing Britain - as a result of war-time destruction and also of modern progress in social standards. Millions of new houses, schools and public and private buildings and structures of all kinds are needed to replace the bombed and the outworn, and every use is being made of labour, machinery, and the extensive resources of civil enginerring.

results.title: The Task ahead
results.brief_description: The peoples of the world want food, they want technical resources, they want scientific knowledge and above all they want peace. The film traces the history of UNESCO (United Nations Educational Scientific and Cultural Organisation) and illustrates how, through this organisation, books, paintings and the tools of eduation are being supplied to the peoples of many lands.

results.title: The Tartans of Scotland
results.brief_description: Explains the evolution of the Scottish national costume from medieval times, showing the stages of its evolution. Discusses the origin of the modern clan tartans.

results.title: The Talyrond
results.brief_description: The measurement of roundness in millionths of an inch plays a vital part in modern industry. Instruments like the Talyrond make it possible to attain precise measurements of roundness which help to produce increased mechanical efficiency. Use of the Talyrond illustrates the importance of roundness accuracy in bearings, cylinder bores, and splined shafts, and their applications in industries which include aircraft manufacture, ball bearings and watchmaking.

results.title: The Talkies : Australians at the movies 1930s style
results.creator_credit: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: The first of the “At the flicks” series, this video recaptures what it was like to go to the movies in Australia in the 1930s after the introduction of sound. It presents an evening’s viewing complete with interval and the National Anthem. Rediscover what going to the flicks used to be like, featuring “Clara Gibbings” (directed by Frank Thring Snr, 1934) and a Cinesound newsreel, the short film “Tap dancers” (starring Stan George and Ray Moon Jnr) and the Bela Lugosi short The Phantom Creeps.

results.title: The Taliban legacy
results.creator_credit: Joan Salvat, Montse Ayuso and Televisio de Catalunya
results.brief_description: Filmed just prior to the September 11 disaster, this documentary provides an inside look at the humanitarian crisis building on the Afghani/Pakistan borders where Afghani refugees were seeking shelter from drought and war and the oppressive regime of the Taliban. Since the Taliban gained control of Afghanistan in 1996, schools have been closed, women excluded from public life and a strict form of Islamic law enforced. The producers of this program visited Jalozai, in Pakistan, a makeshift camp without food, water or shelter which has become home to over 70,000 Afghani refugees whose plea for UN aid is ignored by the Pakistan government. Over a period of 20 years Pakistan has taken in 2 million refugees and has now decided to close its borders, along with other neighbouring border countries of Afghanistan. The plight of these refugees is graphically illustrated through film footage and interviews with Montserrat Felix (the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees), Francesc Vendrell (United Nations mediator), Taliban representatives including Ebdul Salam Zaeef (Ambassador of the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan in Pakistan) and several Afghani women refugees. Also covers a brief history of Afghanistan from 1978 onwards when Afghanistan was invaded by Soviet forces. Suitable for senior secondary and tertiary students. Teacher notes included.

results.title: The Tale of the wonderful potato
results.brief_description: An animated history of the potato showing how the potato came to Europe, played a key role in the Napoleonic Wars and became a staple food. Includes particular reference to the potato famine which claimed the lives of millions who had come to depend on the potato, and how the potato became resistant to the fungus which caused the famine. Suggested audience: intermediate, secondary, general - English language.

results.title: The Tajik people: baking oven bread
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Shows how the Tajiks prepare their flat bread. Depicts a lone Moslem women kneading dough into a flattened round form and slapping it to the vertical walls of her clay oven. No narration. Suitable for school years prep-6.
results.description: Shows how the Tajiks prepare their flat bread. Depicts a lone Moslem women kneading dough into a flattened round form and slapping it to the vertical walls of her clay oven. No narration. Suitable for school years prep-6.

results.title: The Symphony sound with Henry Lewis: introduction to the performing arts
results.creator_credit: William Francisco, Robert Saudek, Learning Corporation of America and Robert Saudek Associates
results.brief_description: Henry Lewis discusses the unique characteristics of the symphony orchestra, and describes the instruments and their particular roles within the symphony. Mr Lewis conducts the orchestra in examples from many periods and composers.
